trans-unit.source: The following steps registers your app with the Windows Store, configure your mobile service to enable push notifications, and add code to your app to register a device channel with your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: The following steps registers your app with the Windows Store, configure your mobile service to enable push notifications, and add code to your app to register a device channel with your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 connects to Azure and to the Windows Store by using the credentials that you provide.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 connects to Azure and to the Windows Store by using the credentials that you provide.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2013, open Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Add** then **Push Notification...**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2013, open Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Add** then **Push Notification...**.

trans-unit.source: Add Push Notification wizard in Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Add Push Notification wizard in Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: This starts the Add Push Notification Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This starts the Add Push Notification Wizard.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**, sign in to your Windows Store account, then supply a name in **Reserve a new name** and click **Reserve**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**, sign in to your Windows Store account, then supply a name in **Reserve a new name** and click **Reserve**.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new app registration.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new app registration.

trans-unit.source: Click the new registration in the **App Name** list, then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click the new registration in the **App Name** list, then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Select a service** page, click the name of your mobile service, then click **Next** and **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Select a service** page, click the name of your mobile service, then click **Next** and **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: The notification hub used by your mobile service is updated with the Windows Notification Services (WNS) registration.
trans-unit.target: The notification hub used by your mobile service is updated with the Windows Notification Services (WNS) registration.

trans-unit.source: You can now use Azure Notification Hubs to send notifications from Mobile Services to your app by using WNS.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Azure Notification Hubs to send notifications from Mobile Services to your app by using WNS.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial demonstrates sending notifications from a mobile service backend.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial demonstrates sending notifications from a mobile service backend.

trans-unit.source: You can use the same notification hub registration to send notifications from any backend service.
trans-unit.target: You can use the same notification hub registration to send notifications from any backend service.

trans-unit.source: When you complete the wizard, a new **Push setup is almost complete** page is opened in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: When you complete the wizard, a new **Push setup is almost complete** page is opened in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: This page details an alternate method to configure your mobile service project to send notifications that is different from this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This page details an alternate method to configure your mobile service project to send notifications that is different from this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The code that is added to your universal Windows app solution by the Add Push Notification wizard is platform-specific.
trans-unit.target: The code that is added to your universal Windows app solution by the Add Push Notification wizard is platform-specific.

trans-unit.source: Later in this section, you will remove this redundancy by sharing the Mobile Services client code, which makes the universal app easier to maintain.
trans-unit.target: Later in this section, you will remove this redundancy by sharing the Mobile Services client code, which makes the universal app easier to maintain.
